intro: Psychotria hombroniana var. mariannensis, commonly known as the Mariannese Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean, specifically found in parts of the Greater Antilles. The plant is a shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The plant contains alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
